cues.speaker: Lenny
cues.text: Thank you so much for joining us today.

cues.speaker: Lenny
cues.text: I'm really excited to talk about product management with you.

cues.speaker: Guest
cues.text: Thanks for having me, it's great to be here.

cues.speaker: Lenny
cues.text: So let's start with the basics. How did you get into product management?

cues.speaker: Guest
cues.text: Well, I actually started as an engineer, and then I realized I loved talking to customers more than writing code.

cues.speaker: Lenny
cues.text: That's a common path! A lot of great PMs started as engineers.

cues.speaker: Guest
cues.text: Exactly. The technical background really helps when you're working with engineering teams.

cues.speaker: Lenny
cues.text: Now, let's talk about your approach to product strategy. What framework do you use?

cues.speaker: Guest
cues.text: I'm a big fan of the Jobs to be Done framework. It helps you really understand what users are trying to accomplish.

cues.speaker: Lenny
cues.text: That's interesting. Can you give us an example of how you've applied that in practice?
